website_summaries.verdict: The 4TB Western Digital My Cloud Mirror Gen 2 is one of the easiest network-attached storage (NAS) devices to set up on your home network. It's an excellent choice if you're a first-time NAS buyer.
cons: Swapping out drives can be difficult

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL SOFTWARE HAS CRIPPLED THIS NAS
customer_reviews.text: Where to start I wanted this to be great, but WD have dropped the ball on this nas its simple enough to operate and that's its, fundamental problem. Its very slow and basic I have the older WD mycloud nas very simple with good software, but this feels like a forced effort to transfer what was working and to change to an operating system, which is so closed is awful the transfer speeds, are a lot slower than the older model after two frustrating days, I have given up and decided yo return it wd need to look at the software.
customer_reviews.author: Lordi

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as good as the older model
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as good as the older model. Mobile needed for setup and over complicated if you just want a network drive. I returned the unit and purchased a different make that worked straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: dave bell

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, rubbish software
customer_reviews.text: The hardware would easily get four stars from me, however it is dragged down by the software. Firstly the desktop app for the pc, only works with 64 bit systems. The android app works well, giving access and auto backup to your devices, except for Amazon Kindle! All is not lost though, the drive can be accessed via WD, with a web browser sign in, allowing global viewing of files. It can only be used if you have a live internet connection, even though it is within your own home network.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Had one for years, fantastic to watch ur favourite films while on the beach on holiday in range of wifi, it failed after 5 years and I decided to jump for a new one, got it after 4 days and when it arrived, it connected but said offline, couldn't put my media on it, totally useless help page and youtube was also pants, so off its gone for refund, very poor WD, I loved my old My Cloud
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: It's true what people say - this is truly awful. The software cripples this thing making it completely unusable. My needs are simple, I need network storage to use with Time Machine and I need to make music and movies available for use with Plex and iTunes. I don't really need it to act as a server as long as it can present the files to the network. On paper this should do the job but it doesn't - it is so slow that it is unusable and everything is complicated by the interface that purports to make things simpler - it doesn't. I believe the earlier model is better but I haven't tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Gagaryn

customer_reviews.title: It's really good honest!
customer_reviews.text: Read all the negative reviews, so wasn't expecting much. I took a punt as it was from amazon so there would be no issues with sending it back. However there is no need for any repacking needed. It works exactly how I wanted. I need to free up space on my phone and have a central place where the family can share videos and photos. It's perfect for what we want. I think, if you have experienced a better set up in the past, then this doesn't measure up. Me as a novice to all this, it is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Smudger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Plex
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for a Plex server. Smaller files do take a long time to transfer though, but larger files are quite quick.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Hopeyy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for TV access
customer_reviews.text: Good in many ways but doesn't seem to work well on a LAN connected to a TV. TV can't see the device. That means you are limited to computers accessing the multi media content on the LAN. Also accessing via the web is obviously slow and unrealistic if you have large video files due to uplink bandwidth constraints - and potentially data charges to receive.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Absolute pile of old toot
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Less functional than its predecessor. More importantly, life is short and I have lost several hours trying to get this dreadful product to talk to both Windows and my Kodi box. I thought it was just me until I googled for a solution, only to find that this thing doesn't show up properly in Windows and I'm not the only one severely disappointed. How on earth can you make a product less advanced than its predecessor and market it under the same brand???? Back in the box and straight return to Amazon. At least I'll get my cash back. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Anightmare to use unless you have a degree in it!
customer_reviews.text: This product is an absolute nightmare to use. We have tried many times, many different ways of trying to 'fix' the issues with only some films etc being transferred. Me and my partner aren't the most computer savvy but also we do know slightly more than the basics and this was beyond us and our even more computer savvy friends. I really wouldn't bother using this unless you know your stuff or want to spend hours online looking for help pages!
customer_reviews.author: LittleMonster

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one of these unless you want a single user backup of photos from your phone
customer_reviews.text: I obviously should have read the reviews before shelling out nearly £190 for this device - I was done! You can't add "users" or "shares" or... well, you can't add anything. Including the USB drive that I plugged in to it (a WD one, of course, which does not show up at all). Having several MyBookLive and WDMyCloud NAS's I expected an awful lot more than this dumbed-down approach to storage. I'll stop listing its faults because that would just waste even more of my time and just list its good points. Ahh... Errr.. Can anyone help me out here?
customer_reviews.author: CWalker

customer_reviews.title: Good value home backup solution
customer_reviews.text: Install was fairly straightforward to setup on a couple of iPhones and Macs. Worth reading the WD support pages for a couple of quirks for support of MacOS and for USB device visibility but wasn’t a problem. Backups using MacOS Time Machine do seem a little slow, even on strong Wi-fi connection, but are reliable. Retrieval time is quick. Backups for multiple devices with private areas plus a shared “family” folder works well. Seems like a good buy at a decent price based on 4 weeks use to date.
customer_reviews.author: ippyiain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. simply awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement of my dead apple time capsule. It seamlessly linked up to time machine and backed up my hard drive without issue. I have also installed the Plex app and am now able to enjoy watching my dvd/blu ray collection from anywhere in the would - very easy set up too! I don’t know what the issue the doomsters were having with this product I personally think it’s awesome and is definitely the best investment I’ve made in a long time.5
customer_reviews.author: beachcomber

customer_reviews.title: Great as a Time Capsule replacement
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of the negative reviews are from Windows users so I couldn't possibly comment on their experience. I bought this drive as my Apple Time Capsule failed and I didn't want another one. The Time Machine backup setup was simple and was finished in a much shorter time than the Time Capsule used to take. The rest of the functionality was a bonus really. I've now got my girlfriend's phone syncing her photos and videos to it and have set up a Plex account so we can view everything on our TV using Plex on an Amazon Fire TV. Everything runs smoothly for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Tsarchasm

customer_reviews.title: Not a NAS drive.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a disappointment, (and it has got worse)! We use Linux and were looking for a standard NAS drive which would appear on the network in order that things could be copied/pasted across etc. Wasn't clear that this drive DOESN'T appear as a network drive and that it needs to be managed via a browser which lacks many of the normal (e.g. right click) commands etc. Does synchronise with files on desktop but will probably only be useful as backup rather than for streaming etc. So will need to replace with proper NAS drive. DON'T BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: BobS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do automatic backup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use the WD backup program, which I had used on a previous WD NAS drive before it failed (after six years). Description says "Automatic backup of PC and Mac computers" however WD Backup couldn't see the drive. Contacted WD support who told me to use Windows Backup as the My Cloud Home is not supported by WD Discovery, WD Backup or WD Utilities. So, it's going back! The whole point to me of a NAS drive is to carry out automatic backups of my home server that I can access across the web from other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Davidor

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly nor plug&play standard expected from WD
customer_reviews.text: Unable to get software working with Windows 10, doesn't use Smartware like earlier "My Cloud" version and software refused to recognise devise despite multie attempts and hours of troubleshooting, even my Tech Engineer who has earlier version couldn't get software package to find actual device, so could not set a "backup schedule" as no device location; therefore not suitable for non tech savie users as would not run in background autonimously (whole reason purchased, not upto usual WD user friendly standards
customer_reviews.author: G A R

customer_reviews.title: Poor Software
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to replace an ageing MY BOOKWORLD drive that was full. The concept when you read the blurb sounds compelling so I purchased it despite some unfavourable reviews posted both here and elsewhere. Anyway, it installed very easily and it backed up both of my phones with no difficulty. However, trying to integrate it into a Windows 10 environment was far from straightforward (and was beyond me). Suffice to say that I can now drag and drop files into this device but the glossy backup software is a complete waste of space and simply does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Rich B

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customization
customer_reviews.text: This product works okay for anyone who doesn't care about customizing their newtork drive or about data transfer speeds. The performance is slow and the UI is incredibly basic with limitations on customizing what should be YOUR folders (not WD's chosen folders). The "public" folder cannot be remotely accessed via the internet (only on the Local LAN) and your private folders are only accessible through MyCloud.com - not direcetly across the LAN. And there is no way of changing this AS THERE SHOULD BE as it is YOUR hard drive NOT WD's!! Product returned to WD.
customer_reviews.author: Extremely Dissatisfied!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very good to listen to your music on your mobile from WD Cloud. Definitely buy one.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the old ones, this one seems to be faster, and definitely easier to use. For those who never use one before should get tips advice how to use it and so on. Also like the colour of it too white and silver, should come in different colour (maybe) Recommend to buy one, simply because you can store all your music in it and play it on your mobile while you always from home. Simply brilliant 😃👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Jam Max

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Not a highly technically person but this product has been easy to install. Doesn’t take up mush room, looks nice and is quite in operation. Once installed you can forget about it. However you need to realise that if you purchase a unit the drives are split into two. They mirror each other so you have a back up. For example a 12TB is actually two 6TB’s. So effectively you have just have 6TB of storage. A little misleading in my view.
customer_reviews.author: nemo

customer_reviews.title: It is ok for personal network storage
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed as I thought I was buying a NAS drive for multiple devices to access files stored centrally. Whereas this is more of a personal network storage device for storing user files in a personal cloud. You can use this as a NAS but only via the PUBLIC drive but you cannot do much else with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: It's a fine home gadget, and kinda mostly a NAS.
customer_reviews.text: It mostly does what it says. That's good! The web client appears to bounce everything through a remote network connection, not just work to the machine. That's bad! Especially because it doesn't say so. It's less straightforward than it seems - you can't easily mount it as a network drive using normal Mac protocols, for instance. You have to run a specific Western Digital client program to mount it, which will occasionally behave weirdly. It's okay, but it doesn't act like you might reasonably expect a simple home NAS to act. There are a lot of weird specific-to-WD pieces rather than using off-the-shelf protocols.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely rubbish, must have been faulty as no way should a device like this connected to a gigabit wired ethernet should be accepting data at a rate that means it would take nearly 7 weeks to complete a backup of my laptop, and that is without it switching itself off at random intervals needing a pull of the powercord to wake it up again
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I got this to act as attached storage as the new macbook pro has a smaller ssd than the previous model with a large hdd. It was supposed to synchronise my Dropbox and/or Google Drive data but it doesn't. It imports some of the data then just gives up. I've searched for advice online but it seems to get confused between the My Cloud drive and the My Cloud Home drive (which is different). Will find a solution eventually but it's certainly not been straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a NAS drive
customer_reviews.text: This product came up when I searched for multimedia NAS drives which I needed to stream music to my DAC hifi music system. This device is not in fact a NAS drive and does not have UPnP DNLA capability. Very limited ability. It will store files and for retrieval by a PC or smart devices but you need an app. to do so.
customer_reviews.author: phydaux

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin (but lacks many better NAS features)
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap, easy to set up and an ideal back up device. However - and my error for not reading the detail properly - it does lack some of the features you’d get with a more mid-high end NAS. I’d hoped it would at least be mappable to an FTP server and that I could browse to it directly from my Smart TV to play media (neither of which I can). It’ll serve as a back up but I had hoped to complete throw out my old noisy NAS but will need to keep it for some of the additional features.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this so I could enable the PLEX media server and store all my media on it
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably straightforward to install. Admin of the device needs WD Cloud logon. Runs 24/7. Faster than my "Mybook Live". Working OK so far, but WD's version of PLEX media server will require re-naming and re-structuring of your media libraries to work consistently!
customer_reviews.author: David Nash

customer_reviews.title: connected to internet but cant view from tvs
customer_reviews.text: suppose to be plug and play can add files cant view them,cant see in network in windows 10,no contrl panel my brother has the older version worked perfectly,only had to add files a nightmare,in two minds of sending back tried support but nothing tried chat not in uk need help. woudnt recomened this model,mobile app says local connection home pc says direct
customer_reviews.author: ian hunt

customer_reviews.title: Good product but Not much control over
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item, as I was looking for a NAS drive and it felt like one. When I set up and realised it is connected to western digital and it does not have that flexibility of a NAS drive. So if you are looking for very private storage for your photos and videos then this might not for you as it is connected to the company it somehow and someone can infiltrate. So If you are looking for a simple solution then it might your product.
customer_reviews.author: e-Nas

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to setup and use.
customer_reviews.text: Works OK with my Mac but can’t get the windows software to connect to it, despite having been an IT Technician for about 20 years. The drive can’t be accessed like an external drive and has to be used with WD’s client software or through their website. I will not be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L

customer_reviews.title: No Good For Me
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quickly and well packaged. But no DLNA so difficult to use it as a media server. Sync was also hit and miss for me, the entire contents of a folder never did get sync'd. Documentation is virtually non-existent. Overall, not happy and have returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Symes

customer_reviews.title: Dead easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need is delivered with unit. and it sets up pretty easily. There is no big book of instructions supplied but the information on the web site is good. We use it for 1 desktop, 2 laptops and 2 I phones spread over two users. I would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: D shell

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased wit this and would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works smoothly, quietly and without any hassle. Requires an email address to set up a cloud account but setup it simple and quick. Requires watching for loss of internet access (blue light flashes) otherwise it just does it's job. Perfect for auto backups of phone and laptop etc which is great for my technophobe wife.
customer_reviews.author: John Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's straightforward,simple to set up and use.The drawback is that it creates too many backupfiles and I can't seem to stop it from copying every file as soon as I get connected to it with my cell.Probably due to my ignorance.Overall it serves me well for what I do and that is sharing certain files with family and friends...
customer_reviews.author: Danny from Tangier

customer_reviews.title: Not what Western Digital used to be
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a replacement for a WD cloud that had crashed, it is advertised as a newer version of this but is not. It is a local area network storage area that is only accessed on your own network and not as the previous version that could be streamed and Web utilised. Update, after around 2 months light use, the unit will no longer let files be written to it and has become read only. A total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Minormatters

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead after just 12 days
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this product, just 12 days after receiving the item the drive just stopped working. Rebooting the device did nothing, the drive inside is spinning but is completely inaccessible and cannot be easily removed. Thankfully I hadn't deleted any of my original data after backing up onto the now dead mycloud. I have used WD products for years. This has really put me off buying any more.
customer_reviews.author: Peter winterburn

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: A nice product and it wasn't too difficult to set up. Do far happy with the Buy. Only thing which is a bit of a let down, is that for any other members of the family to use the storage they need to be sent an email to allow them to connect to the device.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: So utterly awful you even need a mobile phone to even use
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely return things to Amazon - exception here. Thank goodness I kept box! All I wanted was the same WD MyCloud as before . One where you get to with simple web interface on network and can control how configured and setup. I cannot a) get access to admin console b) configure. Just basic stuff. Instructions and manual are utter joke. When does installing a mobile app be a prerequisite for a NAS storage solution?
customer_reviews.author: markhewis

customer_reviews.title: Terrible NAS product unsecure cloud features and data mining
customer_reviews.text: This NAS version ONLY works through Cloud software because it is the "home" version. WD My Cloud will work as a local NAS with a web GUI but the My Cloud HOME only works with their mobile app and a cloud account, giving WD access to your data for their big data mine. Do NOT use this NAS as it is not secure. This is a NAS for people who don't know what they are doing and don't care.
customer_reviews.author: showme_thebeef

customer_reviews.title: You would be crazy to use this
customer_reviews.text: 4 weeks old, 1 day after the return date and it is corrupting files. WD I have opened a case but they say it could be up to 3 days before they decide what to do even though they have advised me by mail that disc 2 is corrupt. So far proven to be the worst back up I have had and it seems lots of reviews say the same.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Simple, buy anything else but this.
customer_reviews.text: Very little to say. This is without a shadow of a doubt the single worst product of its type. It does not perform like previous products in the line. If you just want an external hard drive NAS there are much better products out there. Personally I went with a Raspberry PI 4 with an external USB 3 hard drive and open media software. But if that is not an option for you then do anything but buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive to use.
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as automatically backing files up and it impossible to do. No instructions and have to do all online in order that they want you to. Irritating white led which you can't turn off, lights entire room when dark.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G M Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS rubbish media server software.
customer_reviews.text: The nas is good for the price and ideal for a home network. The multi media interface Plex is not that good and, bearing in mind I bought the 8 tb model, a cloud based system is not needed. All it does is slow the initial setup to a snail's pace.
customer_reviews.author: roger partridge

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst customer experiences I've had
customer_reviews.text: Unlike al the sales blurb, it seems impossible to use this disk with Mac Time Machine. Trying to get help from Amazon is a waste of time. The agent who says "I will definitely help you today" can only offer me a refund after asking idiot questions like "it is powered up?" I tried Western Digital help and the response I got left me dumbfounded. "Can you call back later. Maybe next week? We don't have any technical staff at the moment" At least this reduces my choices. I will not be buying a WD device of any nature, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Awful product....not a NAS
customer_reviews.text: This product is nothing like a true NAS drive. It is slow and very inflexible. It seems to be WD's answer to the home user who wants to catapult back to the middle ages of technology. It's a shame that WD have produced such garbage. I suggest they pull this product and get serious if they want to maintain brand reputation. Put it this way, I'm staying away from WD products for now. They've lost my custom.
customer_reviews.author: AC1911

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up across my Apple devices as a back up and cloud storage. Replaces a very old and slow Apple Time Capsule, and offers so much more.
customer_reviews.author: PTM

customer_reviews.title: Not good experience with the product
customer_reviews.text: not at all happy with the product I used and I had to return it. I wanted this to have backup of my photos. Installation was simple and easy, and backup is quite fast in the same WiFi. Problem stared after backup was complete and couple of days later I wanted to access few photos and to my surprise few pics were corrupted and few of them were showing with zero bytes file. When I checked all the pics I have backed up, about 10-15% pics were lost due to this and I could not recovered them. Not sure if others have also faced the same issue but I am screwed up as I lost many pics due to this.
customer_reviews.author: Mahendra

customer_reviews.title: Returned Item as Not Fit For Purpose
customer_reviews.text: This device was really disappointing. Doesn't appear as a drive within File Explorer unless you fiddle around with system settings. Once available as a drive, performance is unusable (even with a directly wired connection). As a unit to automatically back up phone photos it seems to work, but places all your photos in a massive single directory with no facility to categorise. It does perform a lot better using the Web Interface. Replaced it with a NAS unit which is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Pepsi

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but useless. AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: What an expensive piece of junk. Seems designed only to store your mobile phone pictures, with little interest in protecting any of your other documentation. Been trying to get it to back up all my business files from my PC, and it won't. The back up software for PC won't upload (this is an expensive product, but they are to cheap to provide the necessary software on disc). There is no documentation supplied, and online support is poor. Will probably end up in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Harry

customer_reviews.title: simple way to access your files from anywhere
customer_reviews.text: easy to setup. interface appears as a drive. the 6tb soon works out cheaper than paying for cloud drives for the equivalent. I am using it to stream films and it works fine even with very large files
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence ratna

customer_reviews.title: Secure cloud storage under my control
customer_reviews.text: The device is excellent, doing exactly what I need, which is to have a network available storage that I can access anywhere with directories that can be shared with selected people. Wonderfully useful.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Plex available
customer_reviews.text: This drive does not have the processing power to efficiently run Plex and it can be very hard to set up as a Plex server, the main reason I bought it. Effectively it is only a NAS drive.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up , silent running , only gripe is you cant use any of the apps that come with Discovery would be nice if you could set it up to turn off automatically when not needed witch would help to prolong its life. apart from that it works fine
customer_reviews.author: IAN ROY BURGESS

customer_reviews.title: Easy, low technical knowledge required..
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly and well packaged. Unboxing is a little underwellming, after all, its just a power lead, network cable and a white box. Once account has been created and device attached to power and network, the software connects and its all done. So simple to setup, mobile and desktops connected and software installed. Easy, Fast, Working..!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this device extremely unreliable keeps loosing the public SMB share asking for password etc. Such a shame as WD Hard-drives are very good just this isn’t UPDATE: I fix for this seems to map it to its IP address eg \\1.1.1.1|public
customer_reviews.author: J M ANDREWS

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: I hated this product. I returned it for a full refund - thank you Amazon. The PC-based app was horrible and the drive incredibly slow to respond.
customer_reviews.author: PhilB

customer_reviews.title: Should work out cheaper than renting cloud storage.
customer_reviews.text: Blends in sat most places, got all devices backed up within hours, easy access on all devices, great knowing mirror image so should never loose data.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: had it a while and just got round to using it and it is the worst thing i have ever brought and the more you try to use it the more problems you find so far i have wasted a week of my life the discription seems great but none of it works
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not great for me
customer_reviews.text: Mine only lasted a week, replacement also failed quickly. Not sure if my network wasn't compatible but both worked correctly for the first few days. Refund was processed fast so that was positive.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Woollins

customer_reviews.title: 4TB My Cloud Drive
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I bought this for it was a lightning deal! To maximise how fast you can upload wirelessly, if you are placing away from your router, buy a WiFi extender and an ethernet switch to connect them both which then gives maximum speeds possible. Overall very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Landick

customer_reviews.title: Slow...Speed depends on your connection to the Internet
customer_reviews.text: You need fast internet to benefit from this, uploading files from PC is via WiFi once you are connected to the internet..not a NAS drive.
customer_reviews.author: Smile

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but a bit slow.
customer_reviews.text: The set up was easy enough after a bit of work. It does what it says it will be uploading to it and from it is slow. I know it is over wifi but it is still slower than I would like. Sharing works ok. Plenty of storage for the money.
customer_reviews.author: SRW

customer_reviews.title: Spare Storage
customer_reviews.text: This piece sits unobtrusively and out of the way on my desktop shelves and will provide a means of safe storage and backup for my photo's
customer_reviews.author: S D COX

customer_reviews.title: great bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: bit fiddle to sort out syncing files, as it auto set up before I knew what was happening
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Doenst work with all routers
customer_reviews.text: I own a WD Mycloud and I am quite happy with it, but the Home version, qpart from the already reviews on the net, that there is no Samba support etc, there is also some hardware limitation. Tried two different routers, both could not assign IP to the device, after some reading around found out that the solution was to add a switch. I would have to buy another piece of hardware for this to work... Crap device! Ended up opening it and using the disk for other purposes. Wd Mycloud HOME never again.
customer_reviews.author: Alms

customer_reviews.title: Public folder no longer accessible
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons for buying this product was to store CCTV footage. After 18 months, the 'public' SMB network share is no longer accessible. I cannot map the public folder into Windows Explorer anymore for some reason. I give up. I now use OneDrive.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but this was money down the drain. No instructions; will not register when plugged into USB. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Intrusively NOISY!
customer_reviews.text: It does what is says it does, but the Hard Drive NOISE is intrusive. My drive is 8 TB with about 3 TB of data. It appears to want to re index everything at regular intervals which equals 36 hours of Constant NOISE before it will shut up. In contrast I have a 4 TB WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra which is as good a silent
customer_reviews.author: Paul 612

customer_reviews.title: Great as Mac backup. But not much else ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed this as a replacement for MAC Time Machine. This was easy to set up and works fine. But, other storage functions are really difficult to operate and manage. WD make one use their clunky app and it’s just hard work. If you want a proper NAS then this isn’t a proper NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Taylortwocities

customer_reviews.title: good customer service it was just the item failed to ...
customer_reviews.text: item was delivered very quickly, but the item would not go online and with that, it did not work. Tried things that were suggested and still the same. Returned the item which went very smoothly. good customer service it was just the item failed to work.
customer_reviews.author: Derek P

customer_reviews.title: totally inferior to WD MY CLOUD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the failure of my old WD MY CLOUD device. unfortunately there is no feature parity. whilst setup and basic features are simplified, so much of the broader capabilities are gone and the specific feature I wanted it for, storing home security footage from IP Cameras, are not supported. Its for sale if anyone wants it!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Zinkin

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic performance and rarely have to reboot .... worthy of storing my photo library
customer_reviews.author: Francis I Macpherson

customer_reviews.title: Faulty after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: first time I unplugged the unit to plug it in somewhere else and then it would not turn on...... Fantastic now I've lost all my photos backed up. wouldn't bother buying this get a proper cloud back up if your photos mean anything to you
customer_reviews.author: Neil Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: Software not very good .  The share facility  is  useless
customer_reviews.text: The hard work is good , however the software and the app is useless . Do some research on Google and you will find out .
customer_reviews.author: D Cheeky

customer_reviews.title: Access and Storage
customer_reviews.text: This product is not up to standard, it takes ages to load or transfer the files to the product. but more important it keeps going offline, even when other devices are operating in the network and internet is available the device just keeps getting offline without any form of coming back online by turning all off and on!!! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT WORST WASTE OF MONEY - I have spent GBP600 for this.....
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and I don't have to worry about backing up my photos. All automatically done for me
customer_reviews.author: robert gibson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Useability is frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have 6tb at my finger tips however, I sent this straight back as after setting up multiple accounts and sign in’s I found that I couldn’t control the storage space for Timemashine or create a partition to keep my media server content separate. They say to setup shares but tbh I couldn’t easily find out how to do that. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and start using
customer_reviews.text: As this comes complet with software is very easy to set up to PC's. I have had difficulties streaming files to my smart TV's. Having sead that from a storage and access perspoective PC and Tablet it's very easy and effective to use.
customer_reviews.author: AndyM

customer_reviews.title: no worries
customer_reviews.text: this is the best thing since sliced bread it takes care of all my back ups
customer_reviews.author: S R Park

customer_reviews.title: Stream
customer_reviews.text: Use it to store movies to stream to various devices. Plug and use
customer_reviews.author: janeeta

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things that just work - If you have loads of music / photos etc. Perfect
customer_reviews.author: Peter White

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use and I love the fact that I can access it remotely.
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to access remotely. I love the quality and reliability of the WU external drives. I also have a 1 Tb MYBOOK from WU and it worked great until I filled it with all of our family videos. I needed another back up and bought the WU HOME 2 Tb. Hopefully I will not run out fo room this time!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Howard

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It is the first one I. Have found that lets me back up my iPad.
customer_reviews.author: John Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: It’s a waste of money! Do not buy this device it’s not worth a penny. I had it for a few months and it stopped working. I want a full refund, I’ve lost important data!
customer_reviews.author: Jonty

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Overall is super easy to use and it’s working, only thing is I wish they have more function like able to set up a password for individual folder.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: The NAS drive is great, just keep away from the WD software unless you have plenty of time to spare
customer_reviews.text: The NAS drive is great, just keep away from the WD software unless you have plenty of time to spare
customer_reviews.author: Boothy

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought WD Cloud
customer_reviews.text: So this works great out of the box it's pretty easy to setup, however, it's nowhere near as flexible as the Personal Cloud storage systems no FTP/SSH etc. It's therefore quite limiting if you want to do more than the basics. Having said that it works well and with a copy of SyncMate I keep all my files from my Macs backing up regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, I had an older generation one that broke, and this one is pretty much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: MOISES RAMON SANCHEZ MI

customer_reviews.title: Cloud storage WD 4tb
customer_reviews.text: Not to sure on this yet. It keeps duplicating all my photos and I have tried re settting a few times. Bought so I could stop paying for cloud back up. Not yet convinced.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Spence

customer_reviews.title: Useless for Time Machine users
customer_reviews.text: Mac users will want to use this for Time Machine backups, but My Cloud Home doesn't allow you to limit the amount of space Time Machine will use, so eventually Time Machine will fill all the space available on the device, leaving no space available for any other purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Unsuably slow
customer_reviews.text: Tried this as a local network drive to increase storage. Far too slow to use for itunes library etc. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: R G Neilson

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY IF YOU'RE RUNNING CATALINA
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve upgraded to Mac OS Catalina then don’t bother with this drive. Can no longer access any files on the drive. WD just says they are working on a fix. Would have expected a company like WD to have supported Catalina from the start. Would return this product to Amazon if I could and purchase a decent NAS drive.
customer_reviews.author: AK4536

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and syncs really well with phone and laptop. Feel very reassured backing up my documents.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommendable
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version and this is an upgrade for me my grandkids have my old one and both work really well highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Brian Roscorla

customer_reviews.title: What a pointless piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: Can only map with public folder, anything else you need to use the WD software that has be downloaded. It's slow and not a pleasant user experience. A real let down as I have a couple of other WD NAS drives that work great. Returned the drive for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Its a good cloud/NAS  server but if you want to use is a DLNA media server then there are issues
customer_reviews.text: Good value device, lot of issues with the Plex integration to use is a DLNA media server - once established it keeps working but re-connecting to Plex is a problem - needs attention from the production team
customer_reviews.author: MR MICHAEL J GREENWOOD

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to save my photos from phones, cameras, etc. Does the job as expected
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Ene

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: It claims to be simple to set up - it isn't. Hours& hours have been spent it still isn't right. The synch feature doesn't work on Windows 10. Funny how that's not mentioned before you purchase it. They have a "solution" but that doesn't work either. Painful.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: broke after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up but 2 days after we got it set up it wouldnt even turn on. Got a replacement power cable but still no power. WD warranty doesnt cover data recovery - prices to recover from £299 +VAT!!! more than the original product. Valuable photos stuck on there now and facing a bill to get them off. I wouldnt bother buying it if you want to risk losing everything.
customer_reviews.author: Miss G D Jones

product_meta.title: WD 4TB My Cloud Home Personal Cloud
product_meta.description:
Style Name:1 Bay| Capacity:4 TB

INTRODUCING A NEW CLOUD THAT PLAYS BY YOUR RULES
The all-new My Cloud Home storage device plugs directly into your Wi-Fi router at home so you can easily save, organise and control all your digital content in one central place and wirelessly access it all from anywhere.

ONE CENTRAL PLACE TO STORE AND ORGANISE EVERYTHING
Plenty of space to keep photos, videos and files from all your phones, tablets, computers and external storage devices, in one place at home. Just plug it into your Wi-Fi router and use your smartphone to set up. No computer necessary. No monthly fee required.

MOBILE, ON-THE-GO ACCESS
Use the My Cloud Home mobile app, desktop app or MyCloud.com to upload, access and share your favourite memories and stream videos saved on your My Cloud Home device anywhere you have an internet connection.

SMOOTH VIDEO PLAYBACK ANYWHERE
Stream your personal videos anywhere, on any device, using the My Cloud Home mobile and desktop app or MyCloud.com.

MY CLOUD HOME DUO - EVERYTHING SAVED TWICE
My Cloud Home Duo comes equipped with two hard drives and is set to Mirror Mode (RAID 1), so all your photos, videos and files are stored on one drive and automatically duplicated onto the second drive for extra peace of mind.



BOX CONTAINS
Personal cloud storage, ethernet cable, ac adapter, quick install guide
feature_bullets: Easy to use, the My Cloud home storage device plugs directly into your Wi-Fi router at home so you can save all your digital content in one central place

Automatically back up the photos and videos on your phone. Compatible with Windows 10, 8.1 or 7 (64-bit only) operating systems; macOS Mojave (10.14), macOS High Sierra (10.13), macOS Sierra (10.12), El Capitan (10.11), Yosemite (10.10), or Mavericks (10.9) operating systems. For mobile, compatible with iOS 9+ and Marshmallow (6.0) or higher operating systems. Requires a router and internet connection. Compatibility with smart speakers like Sonos, and support for streaming devices like Google Chromecast and Plex Media Server
Store and organise all the photos, videos, music and files from all your devices in one central place
On-the-Go access: Upload, access and share your favorite memories using the My Cloud Home mobile app, desktop app or MyCloud.com anywhere with an internet connection
Quick and simple setup: Just plug the device into your Wi-Fi router and use your smartphone to set up; no computer necessary; no monthly fee required
Please note: The My Cloud Home device can only be accessed via the Internet, the My Cloud Mobile App, the My Cloud Desktop App or the WD Discovery
